column4: I can't download all the dumb stuff it says because I don't have an internet connection to do it
those programs don't work in windows
I can't look at the website in ubuntu, either
It looks like i have to compile drivers
and identify my modem
and blah blah blah
I also didn't like the install. It was resizing my partitions before I even knew what it was up to. It could have said that was what I was agreeing to
it's just retarded. I could use a real partition manager just fine, but it's dumbed down to the point of being obtuse
and then grub wouldn't install. That failed. So now i have ubuntu on a partition I can't boot to, and if I do, dialup doesn't work
yay, ubuntu!
because Ubuntu is a separate operating system, it is not possible to install it inside your windows partition
I'm sorry you're having trouble with Ubuntu, may I recommend you try installing inside a virtual machine next time
how were you installing Ubuntu? via Wubi.exe or cd or usb?
cd
did you get an error message?
Something vague about the grub pkg fialing to install
ok, I see. well, I know there was a problem with 10.04 and grub that has sense been fixed. Other than that, I can't really say much
So what am I supposed to do? try to install grub manually?
you could. Do you want to try that?

I can give you the command. Otherwise, to remove ubuntu you can delete the ubuntu partitions with gparted, then expand the windows partition, then use your windows CD to reinstall the windows bootloader
to install grub run(using the cd): sudo grub-install /dev/sda
